content.description:
This route is between Frost fang and Tower of the hand. It climbs the giant right hand wall of the huge gully/chimney that looms over the G.O.T.area.

It starts on the slab to the left of The Gift and Tower of the hand.When in doubt stay left. Above, the route climbs through a good sized roof with great holds (10b),and finishes with a nice long run of patina. 80 meter rope.
content.location: Lower off with a 70m rope. WATCH YOUR ENDS!!

content.description: Varied crack climbing leads up to a bulge with some finger locks up and over. more varied crack climbing gains the anchor to a lower off.
content.protection: Small finger size pieces and nuts up to 3.5" piece
content.location: Route starts right of a large chimney/ trough.

content.description: Start just downhill (right) of The Gift. A short easy 5th class leads to a ledge with a bolt. Climb a left facing corner before stepping out left to an exposed arete. Climb up the arete to an exposed bulge with a flake. Mantling the bulge brings you to the anchor. Lower off.A 60m rope just BARELY makes it down. Watch your ends.
content.protection: 9 bolts. Optional nut or cam getting to 1st bolt.

content.description: This route is 2 pitches. Just left of Long Claw, climb past bolts (5.7-8)  to a bolted anchor on a good ledge. The money starts here. Cool face climbing leads to a right facing corner and an intimidating roof.(crux)  Not as hard as it looks.   Can be done in one long pitch if mindful of drag. 2 rappels with a 70m rope.
content.location: This route is the "farthest left", at GOT. Just left of Long claw and Needle.

content.description: Go up Sunspear, and around the 8th bolt, traverse out the crack (via a "cranker move") under the obvious roof feature. Once under the left portion of the roof, A good rest is gained. Continue up the crack (via a few more "cranker" moves) in the corner to the anchor for Sunspear. Due to the traversing nature of the roof, cleaning this route would be easiest if followed...
content.protection: Pro: A couple extra small camping units, few mid sized up to #3 Camelot, QD's.

content.description: From the alcove (the nest) step out right on exposed ledges to a nice hand crack.Follow hand and finger cracks trending left until a left slanting wide crack is reached. From here traverse left to an overlap with double cracks.
content.protection: Singles in small. Doubles in .75 to 2". Bring a 3 camalot along just for fun.
content.location: Between Balls deep and Just the Tip. Climb the 3rd class to the alcove just left of Just the Tip.From the alcove Balls deep goes left and Reynold's Rap goes out right. make an exposed step right onto the face. Climb cracks to the anchor. Lower off.

content.description: Lever up a nugatory layback corner, then scramble up easy fourth-class to a small ledge below the steep face. Tussle past three bolts to a naturally protected, sequential crack pod section. Move skillfully through this section and into more perplexing maneuvers to a jug. Ascend a shallow corner with cerebral migration out right and up to the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts, a few finger size pieces, .75 camalot, #1 camalot, #3 camalot, QD's.
content.location: Route is on the steep open face between The Gift and Sunspear.

climbs.name: Needle
climbs.fa: Austin Archer, Rick Ziegler, Milo Cagle

content.description: Start at the base of the arete, left of a large deep chimney/ gully. Climb up the arete for three bolts making a traverse left, up into a small layback flake. From here, varied face climbing leads to a small sloping ledge below a roof. Climb out the roof on good holds, to a balance crux. Finish up on edgy face to the anchor and lower off with 70m rope.
content.location: This route starts on a prominent wall, left of a large chimney/ shaft weakness. Approach up mixed trail, and large talus, which tops out on a dirt path that leads right. Continue up more large talus to the base of the wall. A roof is noted in the middle of the pitch. This formation is one of a few that encompass the whole G.o.T Crag.

content.description: Climb the beautiful face to the left of Redacted. Trend left towards the formidable roof. Power moves get you through the roof (crux) to the "balancy"top section. Finish with a 5.10 mantle to the anchor.
content.location: This is left of redcted, and just right of the large corner system, and B

climbs.name: King Slayer
climbs.fa: Austin Archer, Milo Cagle, Jeff Scheuerell

content.description: Same start as needle. After several bolts, climb up and right into a small corner capped with a small undercling/ visor. Make some stem maneuvers up the corner to small crux sequence which leads you out and up good holds and flakes to a small ledge system. Some easy moves leads to the base of a large corner system. Clip a bolt over the top and make a "heave-Ho" mantle over the top of this feature and continue up the corner to another crux sequence. which gains you some fun hold up varied corner climbing and the anchor. Lower off with 35m rope.
content.location: Start at the base of arete(same start as needle), but after several bolts the line trends left and up into mixed features, gaining a large corner system to the top.

climbs.name: Just the Tip
climbs.fa: Morgan Nutting, Milo Cagle, Derik Olson

content.description: This is the far right route up on top of the second hill of the G.o.T crag. Follow a slanting crack to the first bolt then a bulge, second bolt is the crux, after the ledge place some gear and follow the bolt line with a second crux near the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts and gear to 3" mussy hooks
content.location: The far right line. The 2 routes on this wall can be top roped, if you hike up and right around the wall, scurry up a field a large loose boulders (be very careful) climb a 3rd class ledge system to the top of the cliff. Once on top of the cliff you'll find a single bolt and a .75 crack, you can use this to lower to either anchor to set up a top rope. Once again be careful.

content.description: Easy climbing to the first bolt. Follow the thin, pumpy, left leaning cracks to a steep face and roof, then join the last part of Stormborn.
content.location: To the right of Reek before the arete. Shares anchor with Reek and Stormborn.

content.description: Start off small ledge, few crack moves gain a small rest. execute the crux via balancy edging, to some good holds. Climb varied face, discontinuous seams and cracks up the arete/ face to the anchor, and lower off. One can also take a few cams and or stoppers and continue up to the Tower of the Hand anchors and lower off from there.
content.location: Starts right of the Tower of the Hand, on the formation which lies right of a large chimney/ trough.

content.description: Follows the first 5 bolts of The Wall.  From there head up easy ledges to bolts with gold hangers.  Thuggy crux getting established in the corner.  Then head up and right to sustained arete climbing above.
Out on the front face of G.O.T. cliffs. Just to the right of "Just the tip"; double cracks and seams run from the ground to the anchor. Really fun!
content.protection: 3 bolts. Gear to 2". Bring some Stoppers.
content.location: Follow trail to G.O.T. proper. Then scoot up the talus around to the right to reach Balls deep, Just the tip, Enola Gay, and "Little Boy". Start at the farthest right on the wall. The double cracks are very noticeable. (even from the approach trail).

content.description: Climb up a hillside to the left of Just the Tip, belay in a alcove. Follow the first bolt over a bulge, then follow the crack straight up.

Dihedral on arete. Shorter and easier than the other G.O.T. routes. If this one was 30 feet longer, It would be a 4 star route. Beautiful chocolate brown dihedral up to a block. Traverse right into a second dihedral, take this up to a roof, that is avoided by climbing on the right hand wall. Super fun!
content.location: Follow trail to G.O.T. proper. Scoot around to the right for Balls deep thru "Little Boy". This is the farthest route on G.O.T front face. This route actually faces North and shares the same arete as Enola gay.
